DataElement.preferredName: Patient Surgical Procedure And Wound Healing Status Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response for questions addressing the patient's surgery and the restoration of diseased or damaged tissues naturally by healing processes at a particular time.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Surgical Procedure And Wound Repair Status
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._Restoration of diseased or damaged tissues naturally by healing processes._A condition or state at a particular time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Have a minimum of 21 days ela
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have a minimum of 21 days elapsed following major surgery and complete wound healing has occurred?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 4 weeks elapsed since any surgeries, and there is evidence of good wound healing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 4 weeks elapsed from prior surgical procedures and surgical incision has healed?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have a minimum of 21 days elapsed following major surgery and resolution of toxicity to less than or equal to 1 and complete wound healing has occurred?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has complete wound healing from major surgery occurred 1 month before the first dose of study treatment and from minor surgery (e.g., simple excision or tooth extraction) at least 10 days before the first dose?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have complete wound healing from major surgery or minor surgery before first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered from surgery with the incision completely healed and no signs of infection prior to registration?
